Text: Response: After you engage an enemy, ready an ally you control. (Limit once per phase.)
Front.FlavorText:
`That will be the Captain: he can master both beasts and men`
-Beregond, The Return of the King

Text:
Sentinel.
Reduce the cost of the first Rohan ally you play from your hand each round by 1 (to a minimum of 0).
Front.FlavorText:
`Arise now, arise, Riders of Théoden!`
-The Two Towers

Text:
Cannot have restricted attachments.
Action: Deal 1 damage to Treebeard to give him +1 Willpower and +1 Attack until the end of the phase. (Limit 5 times per phase.)

Reduce the cost of the first Trap card you play each round by 1 (to a minimum of 0).
Response: After a Trap card you control is attached to an enemy, draw 1 card.
Front.FlavorText:
`See! Some of the Southrons have broken from the trap and are flying from the road.`
-The Two Towers

Text:
The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game.
Action: Spend 2 resources from Aragorn`s resource pool to ready a hero.
Action: Spend 1 Fellowship resource and exhaust The One Ring to give Frodo Baggins +2 Willpower and +2 Attack until the end of the round.
Front.FlavorText:
`It`s my doom, I think, to go to that Shadow yonder, so that a way will be found.`
-The Two Towers

Text: Response: After an enemy is added to the staging area, exhaust Anborn to give that enemy +5 engagement cost until the end of the round. Then, deal 1 damage to that enemy.
Front.FlavorText: `Now I have him at arrow-point.` -The Two Towers

Text: Response: After an enemy is revealed from the encounter deck, ready Gimli.

Attach to a Gondor or Hobbit hero. Restricted.
Response: After attached hero exhausts to defend an attack from an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat, exhaust Staff of Lebethron to discard a shadow card from that enemy.
Front.FlavorText: `They are made of the fair tree lebethron, beloved of the woodwrights of Gondor...` -Faramir, The Two Towers

Text: Response: After a hero you control defends an attack made by an enemy with engagement cost higher than your threat, ready that hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +2 Attack while attacking that enemy.
Front.FlavorText: `We`re going on; but we`ll settle with you first. Come on, and taste it again!` -Sam Gamgee, The Two Towers

Text: Response: After Legolas participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, draw 1 card.
Front.FlavorText: `He stands not alone,` said Legolas, bending his bow and fitting an arrow with hands that moved quicker than sight. -The Two Towers

Text:
Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
While Skinbark is attacking alone against an Orc enemy, that enemy does not count its Defense.
Front.FlavorText: `He was wounded by the Orcs, and many of his folk and his tree-herds have been murdered and destroyed.` -Treebeard, The Two Towers

Text:
Attach to a hero or Legolas.
Response: After attached character participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Arod to place 1 progress token on any location.
Front.FlavorText: `A smaller and lighter horse, but restive and fiery, was brought to Legolas. Arod was his name.` -The Two Towers

Text: Response: After a Rohan ally you control is discarded from play, exhaust Gamling to return that ally to your hand.
Front.FlavorText: `...we have a thousand fit to fight on foot,` said Gamling, an old man, the leader of those that watched the Dike. -The Two Towers

Text: Combat Action: Ready Háma. He gets +3 Defense until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, discard Háma. (Limit once per round.)
Front.FlavorText: `I am the Doorward of Théoden,` he said. `Háma is my name.` -The Two Towers

Text:
Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted.
Reduce the cost to play Herugrim on Théoden by 1.
Response: After attached hero is declared as an attacker, exhaust Herugrim to add attached hero`s Willpower to its Attack for this attack.
Front.FlavorText: `Here, lord, is Herugrim, your ancient blade.` -Háma, The Two Towers

Text:
Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted.
If attached hero is Theoden, Snowmane loses the restricted keyword.
Response: After attached hero quests successfully, ready attached hero.
Front.FlavorText: Suddenly the king cried to Snowmane and the horse sprang away. -The Return of the King

Text:
Play only after the resolving enemy attacks step is complete.
Combat Action: Exhaust and discard a Rohan ally you control to choose and discard a non-unique enemy engaged with you.
Front.FlavorText: `Helm is arisen and comes back to war. Helm for Théoden King!` -Riders of Rohan, The Two Towers

Text: Response: After Mablung enters play, choose an enemy to get +5 engagement cost until the end of the round. Then, you may engage that enemy, or return it to the staging area.
Front.FlavorText: `But still we will not sit idle and let Him do all as He would.` -The Two Towers

Text:
Cannot have restricted attachments. Enters play exhausted.
Response: After Quickbeam enters play, deal 1 damage to him to ready him.
Front.FlavorText: `I am Bregalad, that is Quickbeam in your language. But it is only a nickname, of course.` -The Two Towers

Text:
Play Ambush into the staging area unattached. If unattached, attach Ambush to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Combat Action: The engaged player discards Ambush to declare an attack against the attached enemy.
Front.FlavorText: `But we have a new errand on this journey: we come to ambush the Men of Harad.` -Mablung, The Two Towers

Text:
Play only if you control at least 1 Ent character.
Attach to a character. Limit 1 per character.
Attached character gets +2 hit points.
Front.FlavorText: The effect of the draught began at the toes, and rose steadily through every limb, bringing refreshment and vigour as it coursed upwards, right to the tips of the hair. -The Two Towers

Text:
Play only if you control at least 1 Ent character.
Action: Search the top 5 cards of your deck for any number of Ent cards and add them to your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Front.FlavorText: `...it is a gathering of Ents - which does not often happen nowadays.` -Treebeard, The Two Towers

Text:
Lower the cost to play In the Shadows by 1 for each Hobbit or Ranger hero you control.
Combat Action: Each enemy engaged with you with engagement cost higher than your threat gets -1 Attack and -1 Defense until the end of the phase.
Front.FlavorText: He could see them stealing up the slopes, singly or in long files, keeping always to the shade of grove or thicket... -The Two Towers

Text:
Attach to Gandalf.
Gandalf gains ranged and sentinel.
Action: Exhaust Shadowfax to ready Gandalf.
Front.FlavorText:
`He is the chief of the Mearas, lords of horses, and not even Théoden, King of Rohan, has ever looked on a better.`
-Gandalf, The Two Towers

Text: Action: Ready the Ring-bearer to choose an enemy engaged with you. If the Ring-bearer`s Willpower is greater than that enemy’s Threat, lower its Attack and Defense by the difference until the end of the phase.
Front.FlavorText: For a moment it appeared to Sam that his master had grown and Gollum had shrunk... -The Two Towers

Text:
Play only if you control Fellowship Aragorn.
Quest Action: Choose 3 heroes committed to the quest. Ready those heroes. Until the end of the round, each of the chosen heroes gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, and +1 Defense.
Front.FlavorText: `We shall makes such a chase as shall be accounted a marvel among the Three Kindreds: Elves, Dwarves, and Men. Forth the Three Hunters!` -Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Warrior hero.
Response: After attached hero is declared as the only attacker against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Intimidation to give that enemy -2 Defense for this attack.
Front.FlavorText:
`None knows what the new day shall bring him,` said Aragorn. `Get you gone, ere it turn to your evil!`
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Healer hero.
Action: Exhaust attached hero and Hands of a Healer to heal up to 3 damage from a hero.
Front.FlavorText:
`Life to the dying
In the king`s hand lying!`
-Herb-master, The Return of the King

Text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Ranger hero.
Response: After attached hero is declared as a defender against a non-unique enemy, exhaust Forewarned to discard 1 shadow card from that enemy.
Front.FlavorText:
`Faint and far are the feet of our enemies.`
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a Noble hero.
Response: After attached hero quests successfully, exhaust Leader of Men to add 1 resource to attached hero`s pool.
Front.FlavorText:
`Take this, dear lord!` said a clear voice. `It was ever at your service.`
-The Two Towers

Text:
Permanent.
Setup: Attach to a hero.
Attached hero gets +1 Willpower, +1 Attack, +1 Defense and cannot have treachery card attachments.
Front.FlavorText:
`Beyond all hope you return to us in our need!`
-Aragorn, The Two Towers

Text:
Attach to Fellowship Aragorn.
Quest Action: Exhaust Aragorn and Palantír of Orthanc to discard the top card of the encounter deck. If Aragorn`s Willpower is greater than the discarded card`s Threat, you may add Palantír of Orthanc to the victory display and remove it from the campaign pool to choose a player. That player reveals 1 fewer encounter card this phase (to a minimum of 0).

Play only if you control the Ring-bearer.
Planning Action: Add Brace of Coneys to the victory display to (choose 2): heal up to 2 damage from a hero, add 2 resources to a hero`s pool, draw 2 cards, or reduce a player`s threat by 2.
Front.FlavorText: ``Sméagol always helps,` he said. `He has brought rabbits, nice rabbits.`` —Gollum, The Two Towers
